headline: Antipasto Squares
description: Layers of roasted red bell pepper and deli meats cheeses are baked inside a crescent roll crust.
name: Antipasto Squares
recipeIngredient: 2 (10 ounce) cans refrigerated crescent dinner rolls
1 (12 ounce) jar roasted red peppers, drained, cut into thin strips

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 C).
Unroll one package of crescent roll dough, and cover the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Layer the ham, provolone cheese, Swiss cheese, salami, pepperoni, and red peppers, on top of the dough.

In a bowl, beat the eggs lightly, and stir in the parmesan cheese and black pepper. Pour 3/4 of this mixture over the peppers. Unroll the second package of dough, and place over the top of the peppers. Brush with the remaining egg mixture. Cover with aluminum foil.
Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove foil, and bake another 10 to 20 minutes, or until dough is fluffy and golden brown. Cut into squares. Serve warm, or at room temperature.

review.reviewBody: Talk about salt! Just way too salty! Also, I cooked for a long time, and couldn't get the pastry dough to cook on the bottom of the pan. Turned out as soggy gooey dough. Won't make again.
I have made this a few times. Never disappoints when you want something quick, simple, and delicious!
Yes I did and was very disappointed. It did look pretty, however it was far from palitable.

I love these little sandwich bites! They are perfectly easy to customize based on what you have in your refrigerator (I didn't have roasted bell peppers, but I used banana peppers instead, and mixed and matched the cheese). They were perfect little hand held sandwiches - and the leftovers actually reheated well for the couple days they lasted in my refrigerator!
Delicious the only thing I added was some pesto. It’s just a little something that kicks it up! I made it for a party and everyone said “best appetizer here”!!
I loved this recipe! I added sauteed peppers instead of the roasted and added some onion and Italian seasoning everyone went back for seconds!
Made this for dinner last night and the fam loved it! Also, offered pizza sauce to dip in.

Loved it!! My family is fighting over the leftovers.
I only used about 1/3 jar of red peppers, due to my family not being big fans. Will add fried onions next time.

Made it for a friend gathering. Everyone loved it. Glad I read the reviews. Baked bottom layer for 6 minutes, seasoned with Italian seasoning & grated Parmesan cheese. Used chopped black olives instead of red peppers. Very good!
No changes. Will make again with a dipping sauce. Maybe different dough. Tasty.
Delicious.

This was excellent. Took it to a neighborhood party and had many compliments and requests for the recipe which I gladly shared. The only ingredient I changed slightly was the ham, choosing smoked ham in place of boiled ham, because I thought it would be drier and eliminate having a soggy crust. I also layered the cheese next to the crust, both top and bottom, again to keep any excess moisture from the crust. So my order of layering was cheese, ham, salami, pepperoni, peppers, egg mixture, cheese and to crust. This was so good and easy to serve. Will make again.

I made this yesterday for a potluck for the first time! Everyone loved it, including my husband. I followed others suggestions and baked the bottom crust for 6 minutes before assembling. I added tomato pesto to the bottom layer before the meat & cheese and sprinkled garlic powder on the top layer! I baked at 375 instead of 350 - tin foil on for 30mins and then baked without tin foil for 20mins . This was not wet or mushy on the bottom at all. 
My husband said it was fantastic, but to serve with some sort of mustard next time. A crowd pleaser!
Amazing!! Amazing!! Not one square was left. Agreed with some of the reviews. This is definitely a KEEPER!!!

I don’t think the crescent rolls are a good choice for this recipe. They’re too sweet. Next time I’m going to use a refrigerated pizza dough. And pre bake the bottom so that it’s cooked. I’d also eliminate the egg mixture. Don’t see how it adds anything. I’d use the grated Parmesan but not the eggs

I made them for bunco night at the house. I used the pre-sliced and packaged meat tray from Sam's Club. It made it easier than buying the meats individually. The girls liked them, and I thought they were delicious, but there were leftovers, and I found out that left overs don't hold up well; the crescent rolls get soggy on the bottom. Would be great to serve at a football game get together.

I took this to a neighborhood party, and people enjoyed it. I followed the suggestions~BAKE the bottom crust for 5-6 min. before adding meat & cheese, and DON'Tuse the foil until the end! (last 15 min.) 
 I gave it 4 stars b/c I thought it was a little bland. Next time, I think I'll try a sundried tomato or pesto spread on the baked crust +garlic or onion powder. Still, it's a keeper!

My husband and I liked it a lot. We did add pesto and garlic. There wasn't anything that wasn't good about it. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 star was because I thought it could use maybe a little marinara or something. But my husband loved it.
Great appetizer - good for watching games etc.
Made these for a super bowl gathering and they were gone quickly. I loved them and will be making them for future gatherings as well.
Crescent rolls made the squares too heavy and soggy also lacking in flavor.
Followed other reviewers suggestions and added pesto and baked the bottom layer for a bit first. Delicious!
Super-popular, even among my picky brothers-in-law.
instead of the ham,i used ground sausage, this is a really easy and delicious dish. It is also very adaptable to the ingredients in your fridge. I love that.
No I made it the same way in the recipe.it was so good that's my favorite thing to make.
these were quite good. It's important to cut the finished product into small squares. Otherwise these are so filling, no one will want to eat dinner!
These squares are amazing. I made it exactly by the recipe, did not change one thing, and they were a huge hit. I may add some olives next time though. Cant wait to make this again!

I really enjoyed this breakfast recipe.

I cannot say I liked the crust, but the inside was so delicious.
These are delicious, and a crowd favorite! The only advice I followed was to cook the squares at 375 degrees for 25 minutes covered and 15-20 minutes uncovered. Perfect every time!

We loved it! I baked the crust for 6 minutes before adding toppings like other reviewers suggested, still the crust was a bit soft (under baked). I added mozzarella cheese as the first layer and then the remaining meats and cheeses. Overall, this was a good recipe to try on a Friday night. I will make this again.
Delicious! Very easy to make. Its good right out of the oven or room temperature. Great for BBQs as an app! Will definitely make this again!
Made these for Super Bowl snacks. My family ate them up quickly. Made as was stated in the recipe. Will make again. In fact, my family has already put in a request for more.
Made it and will make it again. Great for parties.

I made this recipe as written except for the peppers which I did not have on hand. They were very tasty but I gave 4 stars because I thought they were a bit too salty....and I love salt. I think I will try pizza crusts next time to see how that works out.

This is so good and I cant wait to make it again! I took the advise of others and baked bottom crust 5 minutes first. I did not use the roasted red peppers. I did a layer of finely chopped onions and green peppers. I served this topped with shredded lettuce, chopped purple onion and grape tomatoes with a very light drizzle zesty Italian dressing. I want to try the pesto sauce next time. This is a keeper!!
I didn't enjoy these. I found them too heavy, and on the greasy side.

I have made this two times. The first time I carefully followed the instructions. The second time instead of pieces I made 12 mini bite-size dumpling appetizers. They were really good and my family loved them. Next time i'm planning on making my own crispy bread to surround the inside ingredients.Thumbs up!
Excellent for parties & potluck meals!

This is delicious and easy. As one reviewer suggested, I would pat the peppers and the ham to remove excess moisture. I put it in my recipe book. It works out well halved using an 8x8 pan. This is such a versatile recipe (you can vary your meats, cheeses and veggies.

This was a great recipe....I had my doubts but tried it anyway and it was a big hit at the super bowl party. The only things I did different was I pre baked the bottom crust for 5 mins at 350. And I added a little bit of garlic jack cheese to the other cheeses, maybe only 2 slices. This has great flavor and was really easy to assemble.
This is an amazing recipe. Followed suggestions from other reviews like baking bottom crust 6-min and thoroughly drying peppers. Will make again!

Very good and was devoured in less than 30 minutes! I will use more ham next time. I didn't use Swiss, but instead replaced it with shredded mozzarella instead I also dried the roasted red peppers as other users have done. I need more eggs than the 2 in the recipe, I used 4 and 1 for the egg wash. Over all, very tasty!!

This may have been a little time consuming to put together, but I thought it was well worth it. I following others advice and cooked the bottom layer 6 mins first, but it should have been only four. I used 6oz of mixed cold cuts, 2oz turkey pepperoni, and 6oz sliced turkey breast to cut down on the grease factor others reported, baked, and chilled a day in the fridge and had no trouble cutting into small snack size squares.
EXCELLENT! This recipe was brought to our Thanksgiving dinner by a relative. It upstaged the turkey!

Like the others, I pre-baked the bottom crescent layer for 6 minutes prior to adding the interior ingredients. Next time I will omit the egg mixture inside, as it added an odd flavor to the mix. It made it almost breakfast-like. I also recommend adding an interior spread or dip to kick it up a notch. Otherwise the flavors are pretty benign.

This is the first time that I've commented on a recipe after years and years of using allrecipes.com. I made this for a Christmas Brunch this past weekend. Other than bringing the oven temp up to 375* and using honey ham (both in an effort to prevent moisture), I made no changes to the recipe. It was an ENORMOUS hit. I had guests who said they don't like antipasto or don't like peppers going back for seconds or thirds. Whether it is fresh out of the oven and eaten with a fork and knife, or out at room temperature and eaten with your hands, this recipe is delicious. The next time I make this, I'm making 2-3x as much. I highly recommend making these for your next party!

Don't really care for the taste of crescent rolls, but this looked fun and easy. Was so disappointed that the lady at the deli counter left the plastic on some of the meat. Not a cheap dos to ruin with cooked plastic.

I've made it a few times, and based on other comments I did a few things differently. I spread the bottom layer of crescent rolls, top with sundried tomato pesto and the red peppers, then prebake for 10 minutes. I microwaved the pepperoni on paper towels to soak up some grease. Finally, I put an extra layer of crescent rolls in the middle, which helped absorb some grease. These were a huge hit at the party!
I used turkey and hard salami as the meats and swiss, provolone and American for the cheeses and it was awful. I will not be making this again.
Made it by the recipe. Outstanding. Next time I'll add a second layer of the meats and cheeses.
Oh so very good!
I made this for a party and everyone wanted the recipe, the only change I made was to bake bottom crescent roll for ten minutes before add the meat and cheese. I

My cousin made these for my baby shower two years ago, and I've been in love ever since. Sadly, she wouldn't give me the recipe.. Not even a name.. I searched high and low until I came across this recipe and JACKPOT! The recipe I've been searching for, for two years. This is a must try and sure to be a big hit exactly the way it is. The only thing I did differently was use less egg as it tends to make the bottom soggy.
Unbelievably delicious. Pan empty in 10 minutes. Followed other comments and it was perfect

Not sure how this would turn out; fabulous! Took some hints from others: added chopped black olives, used a whole jar (16 oz) of roasted peppers. Would now add sauteed jalapenos (we like spicy). You must squeeze the peppers over and over to get them as dry as possible (like having to squeeze spinach before adding it to a baked dish); it's worth it!
Followed the baking time, etc. Baked the crust for 6 min before filling; stuck with the temp & times after that; perfect!
I have a "keeper" file and a "try" file; this one goes into the keeper file. Oh, pizza sauce/marinara are wonderful with this!!
Very good! The bottom layer of crescent roll didnt cook entirely thought though so next time I will cook it completely and then add everything

Followed other reviewer's advice and baked bottom layer for 8 to 9 minutes,blotted peppers try, added a quarter teaspoon of garlic to the egg wash. Have made three times with excellent reviews each time. Have been asked for this recipe twice!
Made several times exactly as listed - always a hit

These were just the thing I was looking for to take on one of our winery visits! Most, if not all, of our group of 9 dislike red peppers so I left those out, as well as the swiss cheese which I subbed in mozzarella. I also sprinkled some Italian herb seasoning on this before putting the top layer of crescent roll on. This is easy to make and delicious! I took along some marinara sauce and that put these over the top. We ate them while they were room temperature, but hubby & I sampled while warm. Both ways are great! These make a perfect take-along food for picnics, etc. Not one square was brought home, even the two-year-old ate one and smacked his lips - yummy! My bottom layer was not one bit soggy and I did not pre-bake it. The baking times and temperature were spot-on for me as well. This will be made often.
Used banana peppers instead. Wonderful!
These were good, but I don't know that I'll make them again. I just wasn't a huge fan.
Kids love these..

I followed the recipe exactly. It was a huge hit at our Super Bowl party. This recipe is relatively easy to put together and was really tasty. It is great for parties where you don't want to have messy, hard to eat foods. Just grab a square and go! Tastes OK at room temp, but definitely better wam.
An all out winner for any occasion, from Book Clubs to brunches to Football parties!

5 27 16 ... http://allrecipes.com/recipe/57808/antipasto-squares/ ... 'Probably less than four star, but more than three. I did like it, but those canned crescent rolls not-so-much. At first, I thought it was all the cured meat; but it's the crescent rolls that give an off flavor. I even bought Pillsbury. Huh. 'Think pizza crust would be much better. Once I get that down, I may try it again with it. I prebaked 5 minutes, as suggested. I only used the amount of pepperoni you'd put on a 9x13 pepperoni pizza. A quarter pound of that would be overwhelming, I think. Soooo, really like the idea & it was good, just wish I'd used different bread. 17 year old boy went for two servings ... hmmm ... it is deserving of four stars. Of course, you can put anything in or around a crescent roll or biscuit & "those kids" will try it! Ha! :) Oh, my 12oz jar of roasted peppers only had one huge pepper in it. That's fine, just surprising - to me, anyway. :)

I replaced Swiss with mozzarella, baked the bottom crust for a few minutes as suggested and left out the peppers because I forgot to buy them and it was still great. Cutting them in squares and placing toothpicks in them is a perfect way to serve.

This is a great recipe. I have made it twice and both times were wonderful. The second time I made a few changes to make it more my taste... I substituted banana peppers instead of the red peppers, used 2 eggs and refrigerated pizza crescent rolls. I also used melted butter and garlic salt on top. This was delicious and a crowd pleaser. My husband thought it would be even better with a few jalopenos, but I liked it just as is. 
Thanks for sharing the recipe!
Made these without the peppers and they were delish! They will become a staple appetizer for sure.
Always a big hit. I like to serve with a side of warm pizza sauce.

This is a great recipe for any party (as long as you are not a vegetarian...lol). 

I follow the recipe up to the egg mixture.

I used 3 eggs, 3 Tbs of fresh grated Parmesan, I added sun ripened tomatoes, red pepper flakes, fresh ground black pepper and fresh oregano. 

The only problem with this recipe s that there is never left overs.

EXCELLENT!!! This is the easiest recipe that is so delicsious!! I comoe from an Italian family and would definitely serve this to them without feeling guilty that I did not make the dough from scratch! this is DELICIOUS. The entire pan of these squares were devoured and gone. I had served them to a party of 15 people and everyone loved it!!!! This appetizer will be a staple in my dinner gaterhings and parties! The one thing I recommend is definitley doing what another reviewer recommended and that is, spread the first layer of crescent dough and add a layer of the tomatoe pesto and cook it for 6 minutes and then add all the other ingredients. The tomatoe pesto adds such a nice flavor with all the other ingedients!!! THIS IS AWESOME!

Wow yummy! Made this for my boyfriend for dinner and he ate three slices. I left the pan out for my roomies to eat and thought i'd be able to take some to work the next day to share; but no, they devoured every last morsel. And now everyone keeps asking me to make it again! Super easy, quick to assemble!

Thanks to all of you who took the time to add your comments and make this recipe absolutely fool proof! The suggestion you gave made my dish come out perfect the first time I made it (yesterday)!! I sprayed the bottom of my baking pan, used the crescent sheets, sprinkled garlic powder on the bottom sheet and the roasted red peppers as well, baked the bottom layer six minutes, drained and patted the roasted red peppers very dry, used only two eggs, baked it 25 minutes covered and 20 minutes uncovered and it was excellent. Thank you allrecipe.com fans! Follow these hints and your dish will be a big hit too.

Wonderful recipe. I, too, bake the bottom crust for 8 mins. Then I add a thin layer of pesto, a couple tablespoons of minced onion, and a generous shaking of Italian seasoning. Two eggs is plenty for us.

These were so good! I made some updates based on the reviews and what I had, but I bet the original is amazing too! 1. Like most people suggest, I partially baked the bottom. 2. I topped the bottom crust with 6 slices of cheese - 3 Swiss and 3 Muenster. I had this multipack cheese thing. I'm a huge fan of Swiss, but I actually think the Muenster pieces were tastier. 3. Put a layer of sun dried tomato pesto over the cheese. Next time I will add a second layer of sun dried tomato pesto between one of the meat/cheese layers. 4. Sliced up the salami and pepperoni a little (didn't both slicing the ham) so I could cut it into squares easier. 5. After crust/cheese/pesto I layered salami, then ham, then some shredded pizza cheese (I didn't buy enough cheese and that's what was in the fridge), then pepperoni, 3 slices of provolone (I will use 6 next time), diced (blotted with paper towels) red peppers and then egg/black pepper/Parmesan mixture, to which I added a little garlic powder. (I totally forgot to buy Parm and my mom had some of the wretched green can stuff in the fridge that I used.). I only poured egg mixture (3) inside and did not use any as an egg wash. It was freaking delicious. I served it as lunch and we had to stop ourselves from eating until we were uncomfortable. I was worried about greasiness/saltiness, but it was neither. I purchased really good quality deli meats which I think helped a lot.
This was very good. The only change I made was to add some garlic to the egg mixture.

Made these as an addition to a brunch. Big hit!! Like others, I baked the bottom crust for 15 minutes. I used American cheese instead of provolone, which can be too strong for some people. I also used a lean salami and honey ham. Make sure to let it set for about 15 minutes before cutting. Fantastic!
I absolutely loved it! It will be a staple appetizer in our home!
Add a layer of white American cheese to make it a five star recipe.

This was a really big hit at our party recently. I had to wing it on the crescent roll portions a little since I could only find 8 oz cans instead of 10, but I just used 3 (8 oz) cans instead of 2 (10 oz). Even with what may have been an extra 4 oz of thickness they turned out lovely though. Thank you!!
These were a hit and super easy to make. YUM!

Made these yesterday for a bridal shower I was throwing and they were the hit of all the food! OK - I followed the recipe with the changes that were suggested in many of the posts. So what I did:

1. I precooked the bottom layer of crescent rolls about 7-8 minutes at 375. I brushed them with a thin layer of basil pesto before baking. 
2. I drained and dried the roasted peppers and the honey roasted ham between layers of paper towels for a good 20 minutes, changing out the paper towels a couple of times. (next time I wlll do this in advance -Even a day a head of time if I am busy and stick them in a tupperware until use)
3. Next - I first layered provolone so that there was a layer of cheese between and of the foods that could potentially make it soggy. So provolone, roasted peppers, salami, honey roasted ham, muenster (didn't have swiss), garlic salt, pepperoni, egg mixture. I just used about 4 eggs per pan. Then final layer of crecsent rolls. 

I didn't have enough eggs to do a final egg wash on top and it was totally fine. I baked at 375 for 20 minutes with foil, then 20-25 mins without. (just watch them at the end). I let them settle and cool - do not cover with foil while cooling!

Cut them into squares. Served! Huge hit! Today a day later they are still so good warmed up and eaten for snacks! I will make them often. It is a little pricey as far as ingredients so truth is I will only make them for my own parties :) Or only very special potlucks. LOL.

It's the one recipe (although a bit pricey) that I always return to when there's an event at work, church or even when I want to spoil hubby a little bit! Followed the first reviewer's comments and they always turn out! One thing we definitely change is the swiss cheese for pepper jack. :)
I like these better after they had cooled and been refrigerated over night. I was prepping for a party and totally forgot to add the red peppers but even still they were good
Excellent! Meant to substitute bruschetta for peppers, but ended up forgetting both. Better than pizza and so, so easy. Thanks!

I made these for Christmas Eve this year, and they were THE HIT of the night! They can be served hot or room temp and they are fabulous either way (my mom even mentioned that she ate one cold and it was still delicious). It is a must to drain and pat dry the peppers, and I diced them (then patted dry again) to make it easier to spread evenly. All I did differently was pre-bake the bottom layer, use one extra egg, and a TINY bit of egg wash (one egg, skim milk) on top. I am making them again for my New Year's Eve party, and I may add a little sun-dried tomato pesto to the bottom layer of crescent rolls when I pre-bake it. 

Bottom line- YUM!!!
Made this tonight for family..excellent. I did take other reviewers suggestions and drained the peppers well. This will be my go to appetizer

I am going to start off by saying that these are totally not my taste and I did not eat even one of them. However, I am giving this recipe 5 stars because they are very easy to make and are a huge hit at every party I bring them too. There are never any leftover.
I added a red sauce, and it was delish.

Made this for a get together with friends. I'm not a big red pepper fan so I substituted it with fresh tomato. I slices it thin and let the slices sit in a few paper towels so their is not too much liquid. Friends went nuts for it. They loved it, and they keep asking me for the recipe.

These were a great appetizer and very easy! Loved that they taste great warm or cold...so as they age thru a party...they're still excellent! Pre-bake the bottom crescent layer 6-8 min's...drain your peppers on paper towels...not soggy at all! Gets your taste buds thinking about different combinations...roast beef, jack cheese, green chiles...simple ham n cheese...a layer of pizza sauce, pepperoni, sausage, olives...tons of variations to try! 
Thanks for a great place to start!!

Made a few changes after reading some reviews. I spread some Sun Dried Tomato Pesto on the bottom dough and baked it for six minutes. I also diced the peppers and dried everything between paper towels. Changed the order to Provolone, Ham, Salami, Pepperoni and Swiss. This was awesome. It all went during the first half of the Football game.

I have been making these for years and years - originally was given the recipe by my next-door neighbor - and frankly am baffled by the negative reviews. I make these all the time (usually by request!) and I have never heard anything but raves. Rarely are there any left. A couple of tips: I always line the pan with foil or parchment paper so the bars can be lifted out of the pan to be cut. I've never had a problem with soggy bottom crust as some others have seemed to. For a single recipe, I always need more than two packages of crescent rolls - I can never get two to stretch enough. The MOST important tip is that you MUST let the bars rest for about an hour before you cut them - otherwise they will fall apart. So plan ahead! I don't reserve some of the egg/parmesan mixture for the top - just spread it all over the roasted peppers. And I most often double this recipe and bake it in a quarter sheet pan (12" x 18"). Finally, you should also be aware that this is not a budget appetizer - but the praise is well worth the cost!!

Made this for an after school snack...a win, the kids all loved it. I used peperoni and ham with shredded mozzarella cheese. I followed the advise to bake the bottom for 6 min, and kept everything else the same. Very quick, easy, and yummy.
Big hit!

I was very disappointed. I agree 100% with another poster that said the crust does not go with the deli meats at all. The flavor was just wrong. I thought this was a no brainer and there was no way this could possibly be bad. I found that eating just the inside tasted good, so it has to be the crescent dough that threw it off completely. Try pizza dough for sure. So based on the taste and the cost this is a no star.

Very good. I followed recipe exactly. Only change I made 2nd time as recommended from other reviews is to bake bottom layer for 6 minutes and pat dry the peppers. Bottom is a little soggy if not. No need to change ingredients, just for me I love Peperoncini and drizzled Italian dressing on top.

This is really good. I pressed the peppers between paper towels to remove the moisture as others suggested. Only substitution I made was to use prosciutto instead of boiled ham. It has a lot more taste and less moisture than boiled ham.
